note.p: Birth: Shrewsbury, Shropshire, England, Europe (7 October 1601)
Baptism: Horsley or Eccleshall, Staffordshire, England, Europe (20 October 1601)
Career: Known to John Collins (FRS 1667) and dedicatee of a book by Sir Jonas Moore (FRS 1674)
Reported magnetical observations to the Society (1662).
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; Shaw; Taylor; Burke EDB; Dugdale (see References)
References: Dugdale, William 'Staffordshire pedigrees' (London: Harleian Society, 1912) (Harleain Society, 63)
De Beer, E.S. 1950. 'The Earliest Fellows of the Royal Society', in 'Notes and Records of the Royal Society of London', Vol. 7, No. 2, pp.172-192

Notes: The election date is Persall's re-election date into the Society after the grant of the second charter in April 1663. All Fellows admitted in a two-month window after this charter, until 22 June 1663, are considered Original Fellows. He was previously mentioned as a member on 4 March 1661.
Proposed, according to Hunter, 26 Dec 1660 and last in 1670 list. In index to BR, [? 1626] has been added next to the date for his knighthood given above.
